summary: This document is a series of internal FBI emails from late June to early July 2020 discussing operational planning and approval for travel and technical assets to locate and arrest Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails reveal coordination between FBI units in New York and headquarters regarding tracking Maxwell's phone to New Hampshire and preparing for her arrest.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: Target of FBI investigation and arrest operation
persons.context: The subject of the FBI operation; her phone is being tracked to New Hampshire in preparation for her arrest.

events.title: FBI Operational Planning for Maxwell Arrest
events.description: Internal FBI email chain discussing approval for travel expenses, deployment of technical assets from Boston and Newark to locate Ghislaine Maxwell's phone, and preparation for her arrest.

events.title: Phone Location Indicates Maxwell in New Hampshire
events.description: Historical data from Ghislaine Maxwell's phone indicates it is located in New Hampshire, prompting the FBI to shift operational plans.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively tracking Ghislaine Maxwell's phone location in late June 2020, with data indicating she was in New Hampshire.
The FBI's Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit at headquarters was coordinating with the New York field office on the operation to arrest Maxwell.
The operation involved potential travel, lodging expenses, and the movement of technical assets from Boston and Newark to assist in locating Maxwell.
An FBI Supervisory Special Agent (SSA) from New York was driving to possibly escort the target (Maxwell) back to New York.
The FBI was preparing to submit a Significant Case Notification (SCN) immediately upon Maxwell's arrest.
